detaileddescription.para: Incoming subscription.
Outgoing subscription.
Invalid subscription direction.
Enum for subscription direction (incoming or outgoing).
Initial state, should not be used.
An outgoing subcription was sent
An incoming subcription is received

Initial state, do not use
An outgoing publish was created and submitted
Publish is accepted.
Publish encoutered an error, sephone_event_get_reason() gives reason code
Publish is about to expire, only sent if [sip]->refresh_generic_publish property is set to 0.
Event has been un published
Enum for publish states.

Object representing an event state, which is subcribed or published.

memberdef.name: SephoneCoreNotifyReceivedCb

detaileddescription.para: Callback prototype for notifying the application about notification received from the network.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* SephoneCoreSubscriptionStateChangedCb) (SephoneCore *lc, SephoneEvent *lev, SephoneSubscriptionState state)
memberdef.name: SephoneCoreSubscriptionStateChangedCb

detaileddescription.para: Callback prototype for notifying the application about changes of subscription states, including arrival of new subscriptions.

memberdef.argsstring: (SephoneCore *lc, const SephoneAddress *resource, const char *event, int expires, const SephoneContent *body)
memberdef.name: sephone_core_subscribe

detaileddescription.para:
Create an outgoing subscription, specifying the destination resource, the event name, and an optional content body. If accepted, the subscription runs for a finite period, but is automatically renewed if not terminated before.
lc
the SephoneCore
resource
the destination resource
event
the event name
expires
the whished duration of the subscription
body
an optional body, may be NULL.
a SephoneEvent holding the context of the created subcription.

memberdef.argsstring: (SephoneCore *lc, const SephoneAddress *resource, const char *event, int expires)
memberdef.name: sephone_core_create_subscribe

detaileddescription.para:
Create an outgoing subscription, specifying the destination resource, the event name, and an optional content body. If accepted, the subscription runs for a finite period, but is automatically renewed if not terminated before. Unlike sephone_core_subscribe() the subscription isn't sent immediately. It will be send when calling sephone_event_send_subscribe().
lc
the SephoneCore
resource
the destination resource
event
the event name
expires
the whished duration of the subscription
a SephoneEvent holding the context of the created subcription.

Send a subscription previously created by sephone_core_create_subscribe().
ev
the SephoneEvent
body
optional content to attach with the subscription.
0 if successful, -1 otherwise.

Update (refresh) an outgoing subscription.
lev
a SephoneEvent
body
an optional body to include in the subscription update, may be NULL.
Accept an incoming subcription.
Deny an incoming subscription with given reason.

Send a notification.
lev
a SephoneEvent corresponding to an incoming subscription previously received and accepted.
body
an optional body containing the actual notification data.
0 if successful, -1 otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (SephoneCore *lc, const SephoneAddress *resource, const char *event, int expires, const SephoneContent *body)
memberdef.name: sephone_core_publish

detaileddescription.para:
Publish an event state. This first create a SephoneEvent with sephone_core_create_publish() and calls sephone_event_send_publish() to actually send it. After expiry, the publication is refreshed unless it is terminated before.
lc
the SephoneCore
resource
the resource uri for the event
event
the event name
expires
the lifetime of event being published, -1 if no associated duration, in which case it will not be refreshed.
body
the actual published data
the SephoneEvent holding the context of the publish.

memberdef.argsstring: (SephoneCore *lc, const SephoneAddress *resource, const char *event, int expires)
memberdef.name: sephone_core_create_publish

detaileddescription.para:
Create a publish context for an event state. After being created, the publish must be sent using sephone_event_send_publish(). After expiry, the publication is refreshed unless it is terminated before.
lc
the SephoneCore
resource
the resource uri for the event
event
the event name
expires
the lifetime of event being published, -1 if no associated duration, in which case it will not be refreshed.
the SephoneEvent holding the context of the publish.

Send a publish created by sephone_core_create_publish().
lev
the SephoneEvent
body
the new data to be published

Update (refresh) a publish.
lev
the SephoneEvent
body
the new data to be published
Return reason code (in case of error state reached).
Get full details about an error occured.
Get subscription state. If the event object was not created by a subscription mechanism, SephoneSubscriptionNone is returned.
Get publish state. If the event object was not created by a publish mechanism, SephonePublishNone is returned.
Get subscription direction. If the object wasn't created by a subscription mechanism, SephoneSubscriptionInvalidDir is returned.
Set a user (application) pointer.
Retrieve user pointer.

Add a custom header to an outgoing susbscription or publish.
ev
the SephoneEvent
name
header's name
value
the header's value.

Obtain the value of a given header for an incoming subscription.
ev
the SephoneEvent
name
header's name
the header's value or NULL if such header doesn't exist.

Terminate an incoming or outgoing subscription that was previously acccepted, or a previous publication. This function does not unref the object. The core will unref() if it does not need this object anymore.

For subscribed event, when the subscription is terminated normally or because of an error, the core will unref. For published events, no unref is performed. This is because it is allowed to re-publish an expired publish, as well as retry it in case of error.

Increase reference count of SephoneEvent. By default SephoneEvents created by the core are owned by the core only. An application that wishes to retain a reference to it must call sephone_event_ref(). When this reference is no longer needed, sephone_event_unref() must be called.

Decrease reference count.
sephone_event_ref()
Get the name of the event as specified in the event package RFC.
Get the "from" address of the subscription.
Get the resource address of the subscription or publish.
Returns back pointer to the SephoneCore that created this SephoneEvent
